security_audit.summary: Pure documentation file (SKILL.md) providing guidance for AI agents. No executable code, no network calls, no file access, no credentials. Describes MCP tool usage but does not perform operations itself.

content.user_title: Use Scribe MCP for Documentation Governance
content.value_statement: Manage project documentation with structured audit trails. Set up projects, log progress entries, and maintain architecture guides through MCP tools.
actual_capabilities: Initialize and manage project documentation with set_project
Log progress entries with append_entry (single and bulk mode)
Edit structured documents via manage_docs actions
Search and query log entries with query_entries
limitations: Requires Scribe MCP server to be running and configured
Limited to projects within ~/projects/* directory structure
Does not execute code or perform file operations directly

use_cases.title: Log Development Progress

prompt_templates.title: Start New Project
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up a new project called [PROJECT_NAME] using Scribe MCP. Generate all documentation templates and create the initial architecture guide.

prompt_templates.title: Log Progress
prompt_templates.prompt: Log a progress entry showing we completed [TASK_DESCRIPTION]. Use status=success and include metadata for phase and component.

prompt_templates.title: Update Architecture
prompt_templates.prompt: Update the architecture guide to reflect the new [CHANGE_DESCRIPTION]. Use manage_docs apply_patch action.

prompt_templates.title: Search Logs
prompt_templates.prompt: Query the progress log for all entries related to [TOPIC] from the past week.

output_examples.input: Set up project called 'New Feature' with Scribe MCP
output: Documentation templates created: ARCHITECTURE_GUIDE.md, PHASE_PLAN.md, CHECKLIST.md, PROGRESS_LOG.md

best_practices: Always initialize project before any other Scribe MCP operations
Log progress entries every 2-3 meaningful actions or every 10 minutes
Update documentation before making code changes to maintain alignment
anti_patterns: Manually editing log files instead of using append_entry
Starting coding without first documenting architecture and phase plans
Skipping progress logs for small tasks

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code through the MCP protocol.

faq.question: What databases does Scribe MCP support?
faq.answer: Primary support for SQLite; PostgreSQL and GitHub bridges require explicit environment configuration.

faq.question: How do I create a new project?
faq.answer: Call set_project(name="Project Name") with the repo root path to bootstrap documentation.

faq.question: Is my data safe with Scribe MCP?
faq.answer: Scribe stores all data locally by default. Network features require explicit configuration.

faq.question: Why are my progress log entries missing?
faq.answer: Ensure you use append_entry tool directly. Manually editing log files bypasses the audit system.

faq.question: How does this differ from other documentation tools?
faq.answer: Scribe MCP enforces structured workflows with mandatory logging and cross-references between docs and logs.
